TAMS32.prerequisites: Basic courses in probability. Linear algebra and multivariate analysis. Transform theory is helpful, but not required.

TAMS42.prerequisites: Analysis, algebra, differential and integral calculus, power series and differential equations.

TAMS43.prerequisites: A first course in probability theory and statistics.

TANA15.prerequisites: Basic courses in Calculus in one and several variables and a course in linear algebra.

examinations.name: Group assignment for all courses during the semester

TAOP04.prerequisites: Calculus, linear algebra, Matlab, and an introductory course in optimization.

TAOP63.prerequisites:
Optimization for engineers (or similar basic course in optimization).
programming in Matlab.

TAOP89.prerequisites: Linear algebra, Discrete structures, Data structures and algorithms

TATA24.prerequisites: Admisson to the course requires , as well as general university requirements, secondary school mathematics (or equivalent).

examinations.name: Participation in at least 12 of 16 lectures

TATA40.prerequisites: Admisson to the course requires , as well as general university requirements, secondary school mathematics (or equivalent).

TATA41.examiner: Magnus Herberthson, Mikael Langer, Fredrik Andersson, Erik Darpö

TATA53.prerequisites: A basic course in linear algebra.

TATA55.prerequisites: Mathematics corresponding to basic courses in discrete algebra and linear algebra.

TATA64.prerequisites: Elementary courses in linear algebra and discrete mathematics.

TATA91.prerequisites: Calculus in one variable 1, Linear Algebra

TBME03.prerequisites: Basic knowledge in biology and chemistry

TBME04.prerequisites: Basic skills from first and second academic year at LiTH.

TBMI02.prerequisites: Basic Linear Algebra: bases, scalar product, least squares problem, eigenvalue problems. Basic signal processing: sampling, convolution and Fourier transform of o1D signals. Basic programming skills in Matlab and Python are recommended.

examinations.name: Written group report and individual reflection report

TBMI04.prerequisites: Three years of university studies with an engineering major. Basic knowledge in anatomy and physiology.

TBMI19.prerequisites: Basic laboratory skills and computer proficiency, basic skills regarding structured and systematic problem analysis; basic knowledge of anatomy and physiology is recommended but not required

TBMI26.prerequisites: Requisite: Linear algebra, multivariable calculus, mathematical statistics. Recommended: Signal theory, programming (Python).

TBMI28.prerequisites: Knowledge from “eHealth: Aims and Applications” and “eHealth: from Idea to Impact”

TBMI32.prerequisites: Three years of study at an engineering programme at university level. Knowledge in eHealth corresponding to TBMI04 eHealth: Aims and Applications.

examinations.name: Active participation during at least 6 lectures and a studyvisit

TBMT59.prerequisites: Modern Physics, Signal Theory, Anatomy and Physiology, Biomedical Signal Processing.

TDDC17.prerequisites: Programming in a functional, imperative or object oriented programming language. Knowledge of data structures and algorithms. Knowledge in logic and discrete mathematics is useful.

TDDC34.prerequisites: Introduction to programming datastructures and algorithms, computer science, at least 45 credits. Basic course in industrial economics..

TDDC90.prerequisites: Basic course in security. Students are expected to have knowledge of operating systems, programming languages, and software engineering. Students should be able to develop, test and debug software in Unix or Linux environments. Some experience with C-programming as well as basic knowledge of web application development are recommended.

TDDD04.prerequisites: Programming (Java, C, C++,C#), Data Structures and Algorithms, practical experience in developing complex software.

TDDD07.prerequisites: First and second programming courses. A course on concurrent programming and operating systems.

TDDD08.prerequisites: Basic courses in discrete mathematics and logic, and a course on basic programming.

TDDD14.prerequisites: Basic mathematics, for instance given by discrete mathematics courses. Logic.

TDDD20.prerequisites: Discrete mathematics and logic. An introductory course on data structures and algorithms. That is, the student is expected to be familiar with asymptotic notation, basic data structures, such as lists, stacks, queues, trees etc., and algorithms for fundamental problems, such as searching, sorting, etc. Basic knowledge in probability theory and optimization.

TDDD23.prerequisites: Programming 10 credits (at least 6 credits object-oriented programming), Basic course in Usable/Interactive systems or similar.

TDDD25.prerequisites: Concurrent Programming and operating system or Real Time and Concurrent Programming

TDDD27.prerequisites: Good programming skills and ability to work with frameworks. Good understanding of how HTML / CSS / Javascript forms the basis for system development in the browser. Good JavaScript knowledge and knowledge of asynchronous communication with server and use of ROUTS and JSON. Good understanding of the web's REST technologies, micro frameworks such as Flask and Express.js, integration of external services via REST API. Ability to build larger web-based interactive systems and to independently run software projects.

TDDD37.prerequisites: The course requires thorough knowledge in programming, data structures and algorithms, and mathematics preferrably directed towards discrete mathematics or logics.

TDDD38.prerequisites: Strong programming experience, familiarity with composite types or object-oriented programming, and proficiency in C++.

examinations.name: Group assignment for all courses during the semester

TDDD41.prerequisites: The course requires thorough knowledge in programming, discrete mathematics, data structures and algorithms and databases.

TDDD48.prerequisites: Basic knowledge and understanding of data structures and algorithms as well as logic and discrete mathematics. Knowledge and understanding of basic artificial intelligence techniques and concepts, including state-space search, heuristics and the A* search algorithm.

examinations.name: Active participation in seminars, and written report

TDDD50.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of digital systems, computer architecture, programming, operating systems, and computer networks.

TDDD53.prerequisites: User-centred design at basic level (courses like System Usability Issues, Interaction Design, Interactive Systems, Mobile and Social Applcations, User Driven Product Development or Product Ergonomics, or Create and Understand 3D)

TDDD55.prerequisites: Participants are expected to have knowledge of: a procedural programming language such as Pascal, internal data structures such as arrays and lists, and theory and implementation of abstract data types.

TDDD56.prerequisites: Computer engineering. Data structures and algorithms. Concurrent programming and operating systems. Programming skills in C. Some basic familiarity with C++ is useful.

TDDD57.prerequisites: Excellent programming skills and ability to independently carry out a programming project.

TDDD89.prerequisites: 30hp advanced courses in students' topic area. Experience in reading scientific peer-reviewed papers in students' topic area.

TDDD97.prerequisites: Good knowledge of object-oriented programming for example Python or Java. Basic familiarity with web browsers and the Internet is assumed.

TDDE01.prerequisites: Probability theory; Statistics; Mathematical analysis; Linear Algebra; Basic programming.

TDDE02.prerequisites: The course requires that the student has advanced programming skills and good knowledge of any software-related technical field (e.g. computer networks, security, mobile and social applications, AI, signal processing, and computer graphics). The student has also experience from programming projects in teams. The student must also be able to search and organize information, and to communicate orally and in writing.

TDDE05.prerequisites: An introductory AI course, Object-oriented programming (preferably in C++ or Python.)

TDDE07.prerequisites: Mathematical analysis; Linear Algebra; Probability and Statistics; Machine Learning; Basic programming.

TDDE09.prerequisites:
discrete mathematics, calculus, linear algebra, probability theory
good knowledge of programming, data structures, and algorithms
machine learning (such as TDDE01 or TBMI26)
The lab series for the course uses Python and the PyTorch library.

TDDE13.prerequisites: An introductory AI course, knowledge of programming, probabilities, and logic.

TDDE15.prerequisites: Probability theory and Statistics; Bayesian Learning; Machine Learning; Mathematical analysis; Linear Algebra; Basic programming.

TDDE16.prerequisites:
discrete mathematics, calculus, linear algebra, probability theory
programming, data structures and algorithms
machine learning
The lab series for the course uses Python.

TDDE18.prerequisites: Skill in one imperative, object-oriented or functional programming language.

TDDE19.prerequisites: The course expects the student to have applied project management models in previous courses or other context. The student should also have acquired knowledge equivalent to basic courses in the profile "AI and machine learning" or the specialization "AI and data mining" in the area covered by the project.

TDDE20.prerequisites: The course expects the student to have applied project management models in previous courses or other context. The student should also have acquired knowledge equivalent to basic courses in the profile ”Game Programming" or similar set of base courses for the webb and app- area covered by the project.

TDDE21.prerequisites: The course expects the student to have applied project management models in previous courses or other context. The student should also have acquired knowledge equivalent to basic courses in one the profiles "Secure systems” or ”Computer systems”, or in one of the specializations ”Embedded systems” or ”Networks, distributed systems and security” in the area covered by the project.

TDDE31.prerequisites: Basic database course. Data mining or machine learning course.

TDDE41.prerequisites: Software engineering - theory. Object-oriented programming. It is not required but good to have some experience in reading software engineering papers. Software quality. Metaprogramming.

TDDE43.prerequisites:
Basic knowledge of computer programming and system development.
The course is preferably taken in parallell with the course Diversity and gender in application development, alternatively the student should have corresponding knowledge in the area of gender and diversity.

TDDE45.prerequisites:
Basic course in software engineering (including UML)
Ability to program in multiple programming languages (including object-oriented programming and pointers / memory management)
Data structures
The student should know how to read research papers on software engineering and search information independently on new topics.

TDDE47.prerequisites: Programming. Data structures and algorithms. Computer hardware. Distributed version management (e.g., git).

TDDE48.prerequisites: Knowledge in Computer networks or Computer networks and distributed systems.

TDDE51.prerequisites: Proficient in unit-level testing and software design principles and patterns. Also have basic proficiency in source code management tools and build tools for software. Proficient in reading technical English texts.

TDDE52.prerequisites:
Students from the swedish programme “Civilingenjör” are expected to have acquired knowledge corresponding to courses in one of the two profiles “Large Scale Software Engineering” or “Programming and Algorithms” depending on which focus area in the course the student chooses. In particular, for the “Large Scale Software Engineering” profile it is recommended to have acquired the knowledge from Methods and tools for large distributed projects.
Students from the international Master's programme in Computer Science are expected to have acquired knowledge corresponding to courses in the specialization “Programming and Software Methods”.

examinations.name: Bachelor project with oral and written presentations

TDDE53.prerequisites: Knowledge is required in basic computer science, discrete structures, computer networks, databases, mobile networks, mathematical statistics, calculus and linear algebra. In addition, courses in programming are required

TDDE58.prerequisites:
Probability and Statistics.
Mathematical knowledge on basic information theoretic concepts and the time and frequency sharing ideas from for example “Signals, Information, Communication” is helpful but not a requirement.

TDDE61.prerequisites:
Basic security course
Basic networking
Ethics

TDDE62.prerequisites: Basic course in computer security. Basic understanding of operating system concepts and TCP/IP networks is recommended.

TDDE63.prerequisites: The course “Information Security: Privacy, System and Network Security”, or equivalent. Students are expected to be able to produce written reports of high quality and be capable of independent work in project form.

TDDE64.prerequisites: Machine Learning an/or Data mining and/or a course in AI. A course in Statistics.

TDDE65.prerequisites: Basic course in programming. A course in process programming  is useful but not required, since understanding the process concept is assumed. Programming skills in C/C++ are required.

TDDE66.prerequisites: Data Structures and Algorithms. Formal Languages and Automata Theory, either via that course or studying selected material (check with lecturer). Some knowledge of C-based languages such as C++ is an advantage.

TDDE70.prerequisites: Calculus in one and several variables, linear algebra, statistics, optimization and programming. Basic machine learning (at least 6 credits) including artificial neural networks. Programming in Python and experience in programming for numerical problem solving and linear algebra (e.g. via NumPy, Matlab or Julia).

TDDE74.prerequisites: BSc in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar.

TDDE78.prerequisites: Practical skills of programming in Python. Working knowledge of deep learning, especially deep neural networks from for example “Artificial Intelligence” (TDDC17) . Understanding of common concepts in computer science and optimization.

TDEI74.prerequisites: Industrial Economics, fundamental course in statistics.

TDTS07.prerequisites: Computer Hardware and Basic Computer Architectures, Programming

TEIG01.prerequisites: Achieved Bachelor level studies in Computer Science.

TEIO06.prerequisites: Basic course in project management, industrial engineering, industrial management, or equivalent.

TEIO13.prerequisites: Industrial Management, Corporate Organization or corresponding relevant knowledge about general models and theories about organizations.

TEIO90.prerequisites: Basic course in project management, industrial engineering, industrial management, or equivalent.

TEIO97.prerequisites: At least two years of academic studies.

TFYA87.prerequisites: Introductory mathematics, calculus of one variable, linear algebra, calculus of several variables, differential equations, basic programming

TFYB12.prerequisites: Mathematical algorithms and models, calculus in one and several variables, linear algebra, linear systems.

TGTU82.prerequisites: One year of studies at an engineering program or similar, as well as some experience of programming and systems development. To be able to complete the examination of the course, either the student has to take the course Design and development of interactive systems in parallel, or have previous or ongoing experiences from design of graphical user interfaces, similar to what is done in Design and development of interactive systems, as well as experience of group work/projects in larger groups than 2 students (e.g., PBL group work, project work, or similar).

TGTU91.prerequisites: University studies corresponding to 60 credits / one year full time studies.

TGTU95.prerequisites: At least two years studies at university.

TGTU99.prerequisites: BSc level within Computer Science, Computer Science and Engineering or Information Technology and Engineering. Completed course corresponding to 6 credits in AI, alternatively studied in parallel with course corresponding to 6 credits in AI.

examinations.name: Active participation in seminars and group discussions
Project with oral presentation and opposition
Individual written analysis and group discussion
Hand-in assignments and active participation in seminars

TKMJ15.prerequisites: Two years of engineering studies. General knowledge concerning industry and environmental issues is advantageous.

TKMJ24.prerequisites: At least one year study of engineering. Basic knowledge of chemistry.

TMKA11.prerequisites: The course assumes that the student meets the requirements for studies in the higher levels of the engineering programs, and has good knowledge of mathematics as well as basic programming. The course is open to students from different backgrounds, and it is assumed that the student has good knowledge of general development methodology in his/her own subject area as well as specific technical knowledge corresponding to the last semester of the respective engineering program.

examinations.name: Inplementation and report of applied project

TNA010.prerequisites: Linear algebra, multivariate analysis, mathematical statistics, applied mathematics, basic knowledge in MATLAB.

examinations.name: Project work with oral and written presentation

TNCG15.prerequisites: Computer graphics, 3D Computer Graphics and Animation

TNM079.prerequisites: Computer Graphics, Linear Algebra, Calculus in several variables,  Programming

examinations.name: Assignments with oral and written presentations

TNM111.prerequisites:
Programming.
The course “Practical Data Visualization and Virtual Reality” as well as skills in visual perception, computer graphics and web programming are beneficial but not required.

TNM116.prerequisites: 3D Computer Graphics, Linear Algebra, Programminig in C++

examinations.name: Planning report, midterm assessment, written report, oral presentation and reflection document

TSBB06.prerequisites: Basic Linear Algebra: vector spaces, bases, scalar product, least squares problems, eigenvalue problems. Basic signal processing (corresponding to Linear Systems): sampling, convolution and Fourier transform of one-variable signals. Basic skills in Matlab is recommended.

TSBB08.prerequisites:
From any of the courses Signals and Systems, Linear systems, Signals and Images, Multidimensional Signal and Image Analysis: Deterministic signals, linear systems, convolution, 1D continuous Fourier transform and its theorems, basic filters (low-pass, high-pass, and band-pass), discrete Fourier transform (desirable but not necessary), sampling and reconstruction (desirable but not necessary).
From course Linear algebra: vector, matrix, determinant, scalar product, bases, the least square method.
One- and multidimensional calculus.
Programming in one of the following languages: C, C++, Java, Ada, Python or Matlab.

examinations.name: Project with oral and written presentation

TSBB19.prerequisites:
Basic image processing: thresholding, segmentation, edge detection from for example Signals, Information and Images or Digital Image Processing.
Use of Python or Matlab.
Probability Theory and Statistics.

TSBB21.prerequisites: Linear algebra: points, lines and planes in two and three dimensions, vector spaces and linear maps. Basic optics (secondary school): light spectrum and light refraction in lenses. Basic use of Matlab. 1-D signal processing: linear systems, convolution, the continuous Fourier transform and its theorems, sampling and reconstruction. Digital image processing: 2-D Fourier transform, 2-D convolution on digital images, 2-D interpolation (desirable but not necessary).

TSBB22.prerequisites: Digital image processing, machine learning, computer vision, linear algebra, statistics, and programming. Knowledge from the course computer graphics is beneficial.

TSBB32.prerequisites: Calculus and linear algebra. Fundamental knowledge in some programming language, for example Matlab, for generating simple graphs.

TSBB33.prerequisites:
Probability theory, estimation theory, the least squares method. From e.g. Multi-dimensional signal analysis: Projective spaces, homogeneous representations of 2D and 3D geometry, perspective projection, camera calibration, and epipolar geometry.
Basic image processing: thresholding, segmentation, edge detection.
Use of Python.
As half the course is project work, experience with programming is also recommended.

TSBB34.prerequisites:
Probability theory, estimation theory, the least squares method, partial differential equations, 1D & 2D linear system theory (deterministic and stochastic). Basic image processing: thresholding, segmentation, edge detection.
Use of Python.
As half the course is project work, experience with programming is also recommended.

TSBK03.prerequisites: Programming Skills. Computer graphics. Linear Algebra. Fundamental physics.

TSBK38.prerequisites: Probability theory, basic signal processing, basic transform theory.

TSDT14.prerequisites: From Calculus: Derivatives and integrals. From Probability theory: Most, but with focus on binary distributions, rectangular distributions and Gaussian distributions. From Signals and systems or Linear Systems: Fourier transforms, LTI systems, convolution, amplitude modulation, sampling and pulse amplitude modulation. (all of it deterministic)

TSEA77.prerequisites: To fully appreciate the course you should have previous knowledge of any high level language.

TSFS02.prerequisites: Automatic Control, Engineering Mechanics, and familiarity with Matlab.

examinations.name: Hand in exercise for higher grade

TSFS12.prerequisites: Automatic control, introductory courses in mechanics and programming

TSKS33.prerequisites: Linear algebra. Basic knowledge and understanding of probability theory/statistics. Programming skills in Python and Matlab.

TSKS37.prerequisites: Linear algebra (can be studied in parallel), Programming

TSRT08.prerequisites: Automatic Control, Basic course in optimization

TSRT14.prerequisites: A introductory course in statistics, as well as a course discussing signals and systems, for example Automatic Control or Signals and Systems.

TSRT19.prerequisites: Calculus, one variable, Calculus, several variables, Linear Algebra

TSRT28.prerequisites: Automatic control and Control theory. Knowledge from the courses Industrial Control systems, Modelling and Learning for Dynamical Systems and/or Sensor Fusion is beneficial.

TSRT92.prerequisites: Statistics, Automatic Control, Basic knowledge of mechanics

TSTE12.prerequisites: Basic courses in digital circuits. Basic courses in programming.
